intro: Ecbolium nanum, commonly known as the dwarf ecbolium, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, clustered leaves and produces delicate, yellowish flowers during the spring or early summer. Its compact size and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
